research.title: Bringing Evidence to Decision-making
research.subtitle: Shakeri et al. delivers mixed-methods research and lends expertise across strategic intervention points.

researchbody.questionsanswers:
• What do current or desired users want, think, feel, and do?
  • What is their current experience of technologies or digital service?
  • Which research or experimental design is right for our goals?
  • Who else is doing something similar?
  • What's the best way to communicate research results so they drive impact?
researchbody.methodsanswers:
• Literature review & market analysis
  • Quantitative methods (numbers-driven insights): surveys & questionnaires, A/B testing, analytics and usage data, controlled experiments, benchmarking studies
  • Qualitative methods (deep human insights): interviews, focus groups, field studies / ethnography, usability testing, diary studies, Research-through-Design
  • Statistical analysis
researchbody.outcomesanswers:
• Reduce Risk: Spot design flaws early before they cost time and money.
  • Increase Adoption: Create products and services people actually want to use.
  • Boost Performance: Improve efficiency, conversion, and customer loyalty.
  • Stay Competitive: Leverage data and insights to outpace rivals.
researchbody.expertiseanswers: Holding a Ph.D. in Human-Computer Interaction 🔗 from the University of Glasgow, my thesis was shortlisted for the Best Computing Science PhD in Scotland 🔗. I got recognised with an Outstanding Young Scientists 🔗 award for my research in sustainable Human-Computer Interaction. I published 13 conference and journal articles with 4 at the leading (A*) international conference in Human-Computer Interaction CHI.

education.title: Bringing Clarity to the Public
education.subtitle: Shakeri et al. clarifies society’s most urgent challenges with technology, which in turn empowers the public to act.
education.article: Technology is a near-constant presence in our lives, influencing our culture, our psychologies, and our environment. But the public often struggles to decipher the negative impact of technology as it is unfolding — or envision better paths forward with tech design. Shakeri et al. demystifies our current challenges with tech through technology and sustainability education.

gozel.title: Dr Gözel Shakeri
gozel.text:
I am a human-centered innovator, researcher, and educator consulting on Sustainable Digitalisation and digital human behaviour. With a passion for solving complex challenges, I have reimagined how people interact with technology --- from transforming in-car experiences to enhancing collaboration in medical practices --- using proven design methods and practices.

Holding a Ph.D. in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) 🔗 from the University of Glasgow, my thesis was shortlisted for the Best Computing Science PhD in Scotland 🔗.

Recognised with an Outstanding Young Scientists Award 🔗 for creatively reshaping and redefining the sustainable shopping experience, I have partnered with industry leaders (e.g., Tesco), government bodies (e.g., Food Standards Agency), and NGOs (e.g., WWF-UK) to drive tangible impact. My expertise has taken me to global platforms, including COP26 🔗, the UN Game Changers Lab 🔗, and the Global Conference for Safety Regulation and Sustainability 🔗, where I have led discussions on innovation and sustainability.

As an award-winning science communicator (both in speech and writing), a certified educator 🔗, and a certified manager 🔗, I have channeled my passion for human-centered design into teaching, serving as a university lecturer on human-centered innovation.

With numerous publications 🔗 and as a frequent speaker 🔗 at international conferences, I’m available for public speaking engagements to inspire and share insights on innovation and design.

'

hcd.title: Human-centered Design
hcd.abstract: My work is grounded in human-centered design — a creative problem-solving framework for leading and engaging with empathy and designing innovative solutions to complex problems.
hcd.whatanswers:
Human-centered design (ISO standard ISO 9241-210:2019), also referred to as design thinking, is a problem-solving process, by being predominantly solution-focused. It is comprised of robust methods and core mindsets that, when practiced together, allow people to collaborate, communicate, and work differently.

It involves discovering and understanding customer needs, defining and identifying opportunities, exploring and developing options, and delivering solutions by building and testing prototypes.
hcd.approach1answers: Using design thinking, I can help you transform your approach to problem-solving and innovation. This human-centered framework empowers businesses to craft impactful solutions while enabling professionals to become more adaptable, creative, and effective in their roles.
hcd.approach2answers: By combining qualitative and quantitative insights with rapid prototyping and testing, I uncover the full story — revealing deeper needs, motivations, and behaviors to drive smarter, more impactful decisions for your success.
hcd.approach3answers: By integrating evidence-based behavioral science frameworks such as the Behavior Change Wheel and Motive Disposition Theory, I craft strategies and solutions that inspire lasting change, deepen engagement, and strengthen resilience.

privacypolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacypolicy.content:
This privacy policy will explain how Shakeri et al. uses the personal data we collect from you when you use our website.

Topics:

  • What data do we collect?
  • What are your data protection rights?
  • Changes to our privacy policy
  • How to contact us

What data do we collect?

Shakeri et al. collects the following data:

  • None

What are your data protection rights?

Shakeri et al. would like to make sure you are fully aware of all of your data protection rights. Every user is entitled to the following:

  • The right to access - You have the right to request Shakeri et al. for copies of your personal data. We may charge you a small fee for this service.
  • The right to rectification - You have the right to request that Shakeri et al. correct any information you believe is inaccurate. You also have the right to request Shakeri et al. to complete information you believe is incomplete.
  • The right to erasure - You have the right to request that Shakeri et al. erase your personal data, under certain conditions.
  • The right to restrict processing - You have the right to request that Shakeri et al. restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
  • The right to object to processing - You have the right to object to Shakeri et al.'s processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
  • The right to data portability - You have the right to request that Shakeri et al. transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.

Check out the EU's GDPR regulation here: https://gdpr-info.eu/

Changes to our privacy policy

Shakeri et al. keeps its privacy policy under regular review and places any updates on this web page. This privacy policy was last updated on 20/03/2025.

How to contact us

If you have any questions about Shakeri et al.'s privacy policy, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Email us at: gozel@shakeri.eu
